alert.note: Alert for Andrews; Crane; Ector; Ward; Winkler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 4:17PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Ector, south central Andrews, northeastern Ward, eastern Winkler and northwestern Crane Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 416 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 11 miles west and southwest of West Odessa, or 19 miles west and southwest of Odessa, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Odessa, Goldsmith, West Odessa, Notrees, Penwell, Pleasant Farms and Monahans Sandhills State Park. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 87 and 115. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for western Texas.
